headline: Why Ford Stock Is Rising Even As EV Division Loses $1.4 Billion Amid 'Model T' Push
summary: Ford received several price target hikes early Friday after the automaker reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings and revenue.  Ford stock rose during Friday's stock market.  Piper Sandler analysts raised its Ford stock price target to 11 from 9.50 and maintained a neutral rating following Q3 results.

content.title: Why Ford Stock Is Rising Even As EV Division Loses $1.4 Billion Amid 'Model T' Push
content.summary: Ford received several price target hikes early Friday after the automaker reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings and revenue.  Ford stock rose during Friday's stock market.  Piper Sandler analysts raised its Ford stock price target to 11 from 9.50 and maintained a neutral rating following Q3 results.

headline: Stocks to Watch Friday: Intel, Ford, Booz Allen Hamilton
summary: 🔎 Intel (INTC): The chip maker reported sales growth in its core product line of PC processors and shrinking costs. Shares pared gains and ended the day up 0.3%. ↗️ Ford Motor (F): Strong sales propelled the automaker's revenue and operating income well past Wall Street estimates.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq Close At New Highs On Cool CPI Data
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major indexes posted healthy gains Friday after a lower-than-expected inflation report.  IBM soared 7.9% and helped lift the Dow, as well as chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices.  All three major indexes got a boost as the U.S. Consumer Price Index readout came in softer than expected, paving the way for more interest rate cuts.

headline: S&P 500 Climbs to New Record on Strong Earnings
summary: Stocks finished the week on a high note after strong corporate earnings and a bit of encouraging data on the inflation front pushed all three major U.S. indexes to new records.  Investors bought an array of companies, expanding beyond the artificial-intelligence giants that have fueled the market this year, bolstering automaker Ford, lithium producer Albemarle and defense contractor General Dynamics.  The Nasdaq composite and S&P 500 also advanced, logging their second straight weekly gains.

content.title: S&P 500 Climbs to New Record on Strong Earnings
content.summary: Stocks finished the week on a high note after strong corporate earnings and a bit of encouraging data on the inflation front pushed all three major U.S. indexes to new records.  Investors bought an array of companies, expanding beyond the artificial-intelligence giants that have fueled the market this year, bolstering automaker Ford, lithium producer Albemarle and defense contractor General Dynamics.  The Nasdaq composite and S&P 500 also advanced, logging their second straight weekly gains.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Keep on Truckin’
summary: President Trump late Thursday said he was terminating trade talks with Canada.  Consumer prices increased 3.0% in September from a year earlier, a rise from August’s 2.9% increase, but below the 3.1% forecast.  Its shares led the S&P 500, adding 12%.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Keep on Truckin’
content.summary: President Trump late Thursday said he was terminating trade talks with Canada.  Consumer prices increased 3.0% in September from a year earlier, a rise from August’s 2.9% increase, but below the 3.1% forecast.  Its shares led the S&P 500, adding 12%.

headline: Rivian Is Cutting Jobs. The Stock Fell.
summary: Electric-vehicle makers are battening down the hatches, preparing for some stormy weather.  When the skies will clear is hard to say, but a recent announcement from  Rivian  shows it could take a while.  Rivian CEO R.J. Scaringe sent a memo to employees Thursday that laid out plans to cut the company’s workforce by about 4.5%.

headline: Ford (F) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of automotive manufacturer Ford (NYSE:F) jumped 13.2% in the afternoon session after the company reported third-quarter financial results that surpassed analysts' expectations for both profit and revenue. Ford posted adjusted earnings of $0.45 per share, 25.4% ahead of the consensus estimate of $0.36. Total revenue grew 9.4% year-on-year to $50.53 billion, also beating forecasts of $46.33 billion. The strong results were supported by a 5.6% increase in sales volumes compared to the same p

headline: US auto tariffs may have 'net benefit' for Ford, GM. Here's why.
summary: Ford stock (F) is revving up its engines as its stock sees gains of 10% on Friday after beating third quarter estimates, releasing adjusted earnings figures of $0.45 per share (vs. expectations of $0.36) and revenue of $47.185 billion (vs. expectations of $43.7 billion). The American automaker also reported its 2025 adjusted EBIT margin could take a hit as high as $2 billion due to the aluminum plant fire in Novelis, New York. RBC Capital Markets lead equity analyst on global autos Tom Narayan comes on Market Catalyst to discuss his outlook on Ford amid tariff headwinds and US vehicles' competitive pricing with European counterparts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: US auto tariffs may have 'net benefit' for Ford, GM. Here's why.
content.description:
Ford stock (F) is revving up its engines as its stock sees gains of 10% on Friday after beating third quarter estimates, releasing adjusted earnings figures of $0.45 per share (vs. expectations of $0.36) and revenue of $47.185 billion (vs. expectations of $43.7 billion). The American automaker also reported its 2025 adjusted EBIT margin could take a hit as high as $2 billion due to the aluminum plant fire in Novelis, New York.

RBC Capital Markets lead equity analyst on global autos Tom Narayan comes on Market Catalyst to discuss his outlook on Ford amid tariff headwinds and US vehicles' competitive pricing with European counterparts.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

The American automaker also reported its 2025 adjusted EBIT margin could take a hit as high as $2 billion due to the aluminum plant fire in Novelis, New York. RBC Capital Markets lead equity analyst on global autos Tom Narayan comes on Market Catalyst to discuss his outlook on Ford amid tariff headwinds and US vehicles' competitive pricing with European counterparts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: GM Cuts Hundreds of Workers as Ford Climbs Most in Three Years
summary: General Motors Co. cut hundreds of jobs on Friday, just days after raising its profit guidance for the year in a move that sent the shares soaring. Ford Motor Co. signaled it will largely bounce back next year from a devastating fire that hobbled a key supplier to its top-selling F-150 pickup, sending shares up the most in more than three years while assuaging concerns over one of the automaker's biggest money-makers. Bloomberg's Craig Trudell reports.

content.title: GM Cuts Hundreds of Workers as Ford Climbs Most in Three Years
content.description: General Motors Co. cut hundreds of jobs on Friday, just days after raising its profit guidance for the year in a move that sent the shares soaring. Ford Motor Co. signaled it will largely bounce back next year from a devastating fire that hobbled a key supplier to its top-selling F-150 pickup, sending shares up the most in more than three years while assuaging concerns over one of the automaker's biggest money-makers. Bloomberg's Craig Trudell reports.

Bloomberg's Craig Trudell reports.

headline: Ford stock shakes off $1.5 billion hit from Novelis fire on news plant will reopen this year
summary: Big Three automaker Ford reported third-quarter results after the bell that topped expectations, but the company projected financial hits due to the aluminum plant fire that impacted Ford's franchise F-150 pickups and SUVs. However news that the plant will re-open early, and the strength of Ford's underlying business before the plant closure, has the stock jumping.

content.title: Ford stock shakes off $1.5 billion hit from Novelis fire on news plant will reopen this year
content.summary: Big Three automaker Ford reported third-quarter results after the bell that topped expectations, but the company projected financial hits due to the aluminum plant fire that impacted Ford's franchise F-150 pickups and SUVs. However news that the plant will re-open early, and the strength of Ford's underlying business before the plant closure, has the stock jumping.

headline: F Q3 Deep Dive: Strong Execution, Industrial Progress, and Regulatory Tailwinds Drive Results
summary: Automotive manufacturer Ford (NYSE:F) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.4% year on year to $50.53 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.45 per share was 25.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Google, Ford, Intel, Quantum: Trending stocks
summary: Google's (GOOG, GOOGL) new AI deal with Anthropic sends shares up. Ford (F) moves workers away from its electric F-150 to focus on the diesel and hybrid versions. Intel (INTC) shares soar on an earnings beat, and quantum computing stocks (RGTI, QBTS, IONQ) continue their latest rally for a second day. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Wall Street hits records following an encouraging update on inflation
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rallied 472 points, or 1%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 1.1%.  The Fed just cut its main interest rate last month for the first time this year, but it’s been hesitant to promise more relief because lower rates can make inflation worse, beyond goosing the economy and prices for investments.  Following the inflation report, traders continue to bet on a near certainty that the Fed will cut rates at its next two meetings, including one next week.

content.title: Wall Street hits records following an encouraging update on inflation
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rallied 472 points, or 1%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 1.1%.  The Fed just cut its main interest rate last month for the first time this year, but it’s been hesitant to promise more relief because lower rates can make inflation worse, beyond goosing the economy and prices for investments.  Following the inflation report, traders continue to bet on a near certainty that the Fed will cut rates at its next two meetings, including one next week.
